- UPLINK (2021-12-13): 8 inspiring innovations that are helping to fight plastic pollution

Every year, eight million tonnes of plastic pollution ends up drifting or sinking in the ocean.

Plastic pollution is a global problem, threatening both the health of humans and ecosystems all over the world.

In June 2021, the Global Plastic Action Partnership and UpLink launched the Global Plastic Innovation Network (GPIN), aiming to source innovative solutions to help stem the flow of plastic pollution.

Through the Global Plastic Innovation Network (GPIN), high impact innovators are being gathered to tackle pollution at the national and global level. Dealing with plastic pollution demands creativity, from re-designing packaging and delivery models to implementing new recycling technologies that address waste production and management.

- Innovations that are fighting plastic pollution:
  - Siklus: Reimagining retail in Indonesia with refill stations to reduce plastic waste.
  - gCycle: Introducing fully compostable and disposable nappies to address the sustainability issues in the nappy industry.
  - Plastic Fischer: Developing low-tech plastic collection systems for rivers, with successful deployment in the Citarum River in Bali.
  - Diwama: Providing AI-based technology for waste-sorting facilities to optimize waste management.
  - RiverRecycle: Offering disruptive methods to alter waste management systems by collecting and recycling plastic waste in rivers.
  - Waste Bazaar: Providing waste collection and recycling services in Nigeria through a mobile app that connects users to recycling stations.
  - Wasser 3.0: Developed a solution to remove microplastic and micropollutants from water effectively.
  - TONTOTON: Building a system in Vietnam and Cambodia, empowering local waste pickers to address plastic pollution.

The Global Plastic Innovation Network is supported by Government funding from the UK’s Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs and Global Affairs Canada.
